roleset.name: to leave temporarily
roleset.note: PARK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'park' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from park.01-v predicate notes)
PARKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, park-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls put-9.1-1. (from parking.01-n)

example.name: passive
example.text: [Much of the excess spending]-3 will be pushed [*-3]into fiscal 1991 , and in some cases is temporarily parked [*-3] in slow-spending accounts in anticipation of [*] being transferred [*-1] to faster-spending areas after the budget scorekeeping is completed [*-2] .
example.arg: in anticipation of [*] being transferred [*-1]to faster-spending areas after the budget scorekeeping is completed [*-2]

example.name: infinitive
example.text: Its radio series features such spots as `` Floodlights : Evening Wear for Urban Structures '' and `` [*] Building a Place [0][*] to Park [*T*-1] . ''

example.name: all args
example.text: He says there's nothing wrong with his parking the vans, which he owns, at the church.
